message.raw:
Reopening.

The bug is that, while there is an error to catch the rcc executable not existing (which notifies about the NO_XXX options), this doesn't happen because it first tries to import the library (see [here](#!/philipstarkey/qtutils/src/d087c7e6fc80c43463bbb88f3a77a90e41f46e81/qtutils/icons/_build.py#lines-57)). I have no idea why it's importing the library because it doesn't seem to ever use it....but it does the same thing for all 4 of the python Qt wrappers.
message.html:
Reopening.

The bug is that, while there is an error to catch the rcc executable not existing (which notifies about the NO_XXX options), this doesn't happen because it first tries to import the library (see here). I have no idea why it's importing the library because it doesn't seem to ever use it....but it does the same thing for all 4 of the python Qt wrappers.
